title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Splat! Could roadkill replace some studies of live animals?
items.description: <cite>Science</cite> chats with an ecologist about the advantages of using discarded carcasses for research

items.title: Fluttering ‘tails’ on bird nests confuse would-be predators
items.description: Blue manakins in Brazil use “disruptive camouflage” to protect their eggs, new study finds

items.title: Congress set to cut defense science funding
items.description: But lawmakers reject Trump’s call for deeper downsizing and boost medical research

items.title: U.S. government has lost more than 10,000 STEM Ph.D.s since Trump took office
items.description: A <cite>Science</cite> analysis reveals how many were fired, retired, or quit across 14 agencies

items.title: Controversial Chilean energy project scrapped, relieving astronomers
items.description: Light pollution from green hydrogen plant would have threatened world’s largest telescopes

items.title: Oldest wooden tools may have been used to butcher elephants
items.description: Branches sharpened 400,000 years ago shine light on humans’ early toolmaking

items.title: Earthquake sensors buried in the quietest spot on Earth
items.description: Deep beneath the South Pole, two seismometers will monitor the planet’s interior and the movement of Antarctic ice

items.title: Tidal waves of lava may slosh around alien worlds
items.description: Waves of molten rock could be confounding observations of atmospheres on distant planets

items.title: Bird flu antibodies found in cow in the Netherlands, a first outside of U.S.
items.description: Dead cat led to discovery, but officials stress no further spread of H5N1 has been detected

items.title: ArXiv preprint server clamps down on AI slop
items.description: First-time posters to venerable platform now need an endorsement from an established author
